metadata.title: CVE-2023-4578 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: When calling `JS::CheckRegExpSyntax` a Syntax Error could have been setwhich would end in calling `convertToRuntimeErrorAndClear`. A path in thefunction could attempt to allocate memory when none is available whichwould have caused a newly created Out of Memory exception to be mishandledas a Syntax Error. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 117, Firefox ESR <115.2, and Thunderbird < 115.2.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
